{{Short description|American singer and songwriter}} {{distinguish|Canaan Smith (EP)|Canaan Smith-Njigba}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Canaan Smith | image = | alt = | caption = | image_size = | landscape = | birth_name = Canaan Lee Smith{{cite web|url=http://repertoire.bmi.com/writer.asp?blnWriter=True&blnPublisher=True&blnArtist=True&page=1&fromrow=1&torow=25&querytype=WriterID&keyid=1186259&keyname=SMITH+CANAAN+LEE&CAE=468847888&Affiliation=ASCAP|title=Songwriter/Composer: SMITH CANAAN LEE|last=Smith|first=Canaan Lee|publisher=[[Broadcast Music, Inc.]] (BMI)|access-date=May 6, 2015}}{{Dead link|date=June 2019 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|08|24}} | birth_place = [[Dillsboro, Indiana]], U.S. | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}} | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar}} | years_active = 2009–present | label = Round Here, [[AWAL]], [[Mercury Nashville Records|Mercury Nashville]] | associated_acts = | spouse = {{marriage|Christy Hardesty|2014}} | website = {{URL|http://canaansmith.com/}} }} '''Canaan Lee Smith''' (born August 24, 1982) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter signed with Round Here Records, an independent label started by [[Florida Georgia Line]]. He has released two albums, ''[[Bronco (Canaan Smith album)|Bronco]]'' in 2015 and ''[[High Country Sound]]'' in 2021. His second single, "[[Love You Like That]]", was a Number One hit on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart. He was also a [[reality television]] contestant on the [[The Amazing Race 15|15th season]] of ''[[The Amazing Race (American TV series)|The Amazing Race]]''.{{cite web|last=Dukes|first=Billy|title=Canaan Smith, 'We Got Us' – Song Review|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/canaan-smith-we-got-us/|work=Taste of Country|access-date=February 8, 2012|date=December 12, 2011}} ==Career== ===2009-2017: Mercury Nashville and ''Bronco''=== In 2009, Smith moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] in search of a musical career and co-wrote the hit "[[Runaway (Love and Theft song)|Runaway]]" by country band [[Love and Theft (band)|Love and Theft]]{{cite web|title=Maniac Exchange "Nashville's Breakout Star- Canaan Smith"|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/artist/detail.aspx?nid=7345&aid=224|access-date=February 8, 2012}} which made it to number 10 in the Billboard [[Hot Country Songs]] and 65 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in 2009.{{Cite web |url=http://www.fox17.com/newsroom/top_stories/videos/wztv_vid_10951.shtml |title=WZTV Fox 17: Artist to Watch - Canaan Smith |access-date=February 9, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120219090226/http://www.fox17.com/newsroom/top_stories/videos/wztv_vid_10951.shtml |archive-date=February 19, 2012 |url-status=dead }}[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=love and theft|chart=all}} ''Billboard'' magazine: Page for "Runaway" by Love and Theft] His debut single, "[[We Got Us]]", was released in January 2012 after being made available on [[ITunes Store|iTunes]] starting December 24, 2011. The song was written by Stephen Barker Liles, [[Tommy Lee James]], and Smith; it was produced by [[Brett Beavers]] and Luke Wooten{{cite web|last=Bjorke|first=Matt|title=Single Review: Canaan Smith - We Got Us|url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/single-review-canaan-smith-we-got-us|work=Roughstock|access-date=February 8, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140427083739/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/single-review-canaan-smith-we-got-us|archive-date=April 27, 2014|url-status=dead}} and it debuted at number 53 on the country music charts.{{cite web|title=Billboard Country Music Charts|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=canaan smith|chart=Country Songs}}|access-date=February 8, 2012}} The music video, directed by Brian Lazarro, was broadcast on [[Great American Family|GAC]] and was on the "GAC Top 20 Ballot". ''[[Country Weekly]]'' magazine named him as an artist to notice in "Ones to Watch in 2012",{{cite web|title=Canaan Smith: News: Universal Music Nashville|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/artist/detail.aspx?nid=7271&aid=224|website=Umgnashville.com}} as did Roughstock.com. Smith returned to the studio in February 2012 to finish his debut album. On July 21, 2014, he released his second single, titled "Love You Like That". The music video was released on [[Vevo]] on September 10, 2014. In October 2014, he was featured as one of the "10 New Artists You Need To Know: Fall 2014" in [[Rolling Stone|Rolling Stone Country]].{{cite web|title=10 New Artists You Need To Know|date=2014|access-date=December 8, 2014|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/new-country-artists-2014-20141010/canaan-smith-20141010|website=Rollingstone.com}} On March 24, 2015, he released a self-titled EP.{{cite web |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/canaan-smith-ep/ |title= Canaan Smith Announces Self-Titled EP|author= Rebekah Bell |date=February 23, 2015|work=Taste of Country }} The EP debuted at No. 16 on the Top Country Albums chart and at No. 97 on the Billboard 200, with 2,900 copies sold in the US for the week.{{cite news|title=Country Album Chart Report For April 1, 2015|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/04/33971-country-album-chart-report-april-1-2015/|last=Bjorke|first=Matt|publisher=Roughstock|date=April 1, 2015}}[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1goiv8VEJT5SrnXu3_fJM'bDyTQr2MhYwHN914iflIH7g/edit#gid=0]{{Dead link|date=August 2019|bot=InternetArchiveBot|fix-attempted=yes}} On June 23, he released his first full-length studio album, titled ''[[Bronco (Canaan Smith album)|Bronco]]''.{{cite web | url=http://radio.com/2015/04/29/canaan-smith-debut-album-bronco/ | title=Canaan Smith Announces Debut Album, 'Bronco' | publisher=Radio.com | date=April 29, 2015 | access-date=September 18, 2015}} "Love You Like That" reached number one on the [[Country Airplay]] chart in July 2015,{{cite web | url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6633477/country-charts-canaan-smith-lands-at-no-1-video-spurs-steven | title=Country Charts: Canaan Smith Lands At No. 1, Video Spurs Steven Tyler Gain | publisher=Billboard | date=July 14, 2015 | access-date=September 18, 2015}} and number 46 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. The second single from the album, "Hole in a Bottle," was released in August.{{cite web | url=http://tasteofcountry.com/canaan-smith-hole-in-a-bottle/ | title=Canaan Smith, 'Hole in a Bottle' [Listen] | publisher=Taste of Country | date=August 31, 2015 | access-date=September 18, 2015}} In September, Smith announced his first headlining concert tour, the Stompin' Grounds Tour, with support from [[Russell Dickerson]].{{cite web | url=http://tasteofcountry.com/canaan-smith-headlining-tour-dates-2015/ | title=Canaan Smith Embarking on First Headlining Tour | publisher=Taste of Country | date=September 18, 2015 | access-date=September 18, 2015}} In 2016, Smith appeared in the season four finale of ''[[Bar Rescue]]'' performing during the grand re-opening of The Gallopin' Goose. ===2018-present: Round Here Records and Tree Vibez Music=== In March 2018, Smith parted ways with the label [[Mercury Nashville]]. In May 2018, he signed as a songwriter with publishing company [[Tree Vibez Music]]{{cite web | url=https://nashvegas.com/canaan-smith-signs-tree-vibez-music/| title=Rising country hitmaker Canaan Smith signs to Tree Vibez Music| publisher=NashVegas.com | date=May 25, 2018 | access-date=August 17, 2019}} which was founded by [[Tyler Hubbard]] and [[Brian Kelley (musician)|Brian Kelley]] of [[Florida Georgia Line]]. In February 2019, it was announced that Smith would join [[Florida Georgia Line]] on their [[Can't Say I Ain't Country Tour|Can’t Say I Ain’t Country Tour]] on select dates alongside [[Dan + Shay]], [[Morgan Wallen]], and [[Hardy (singer)|HARDY]].{{Cite web|url=http://theboot.com/florida-georgia-line-new-album-2019-details-information/|title=Everything We Know About Florida Georgia Line's New Album, 'Can't Say I Ain't Country'|last=Konc|first=Riane|website=The Boot|language=en|access-date=2019-02-02}} In August 2019, Smith signed with [[Round Here Records]] as their flagship artist,{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8527481/florida-georgia-line-round-here-records-canaan-smith|last=Reuter|first=Annie| title=Florida Georgia Line Launch Round Here Records With Flagship Artist Canaan Smith: Exclusive| publisher=Billboard | date=August 15, 2019 | access-date=August 17, 2019}} and released a new track titled “Beer Drinking Weather”. The label began operations on the same day and is run by Hubbard and Kelley who also co-wrote the new track. In June 2020, Smith released his first single to country radio in three years, "Colder Than You".{{cite web | url= https://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/ef-country/canaan-smith-debuts-new-track-colder-than-you/|last=Ellwood-Hughes|first=Pip| title=Canaan Smith debuts new track Colder Than You | publisher=Entertainment Focus| date=June 9, 2020 | access-date=June 15, 2020}} His second studio album, ''[[High Country Sound]]'', was released on April 2, 2021.{{cite web | url=https://entertainment-focus.com/2021/03/19/canaan-smith-to-release-new-album-high-country-sound-in-april/|last=Ellwood-Hughes|first=Pip| title=Canaan Smith To Release New Album 'High Country Sound' In April| publisher=Entertainment Focus|date=March 19, 2021}} ==Personal life== Smith graduated from [[Lafayette High School (Williamsburg, Virginia)|Lafayette High School]] in [[Williamsburg, Virginia]]{{cite web | url=http://tasteofcountry.com/canaan-smith-love-you-like-that/ | title=Canaan Smith, 'Love You Like That' [Listen] | publisher=Taste of Country | date=October 16, 2014 | access-date=September 18, 2015}} and attended [[Belmont University]] in Nashville.{{cite web | url=http://country929.com/daily-scoop/country-music-news/2015/06/canaan-smith-goes-way-back-with-fgl/ | title=Canaan Smith Goes Way Back With FGL | publisher=Country 92.9 | date=June 17, 2015 | access-date=September 18, 2015}} He and his then-girlfriend, Mika Combs, were the seventh team eliminated in the [[The Amazing Race 15|15th season]] of ''[[The Amazing Race (American TV series)|The Amazing Race]]''.{{cite web|last=Parks|first=Tim|title=Mika Combs, Canaan Smith ('Amazing Race')|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/tv/s66/the-amazing-race/interviews/a183789/mika-combs-canaan-smith-amazing-race.html|work=Digital Spy|access-date=February 8, 2012|date=October 26, 2009}} In March 2014, Smith became engaged to his girlfriend Christy Hardesty and they married in August 2014. On October 31, 2019, they welcomed their daughter Virginia Rose Smith.{{Cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/canaan-smith-wife-baby-girl/|title=Canaan Smith and Wife Welcome First Child — a Surprise Baby Girl!|first=Jacklyn|last=Krol|website=Taste of Country|date=November 7, 2019 }}{{Cite web|url=https://people.com/parents/canaan-smith-expecting-first-child-wife-christy-pregnant-exclusive/|title=Country Singer Canaan Smith and Wife Christy Expecting First Child: 'Best Moment of My Life'|website=PEOPLE.com}} == Discography == === Studio albums === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
